titleStmt.title: A most excellent ballad of an old man and his wife: who in their want and misery sought to their children for succour, by whom they were disdained, and scornfully sent them away succourless, and Gods vengeance shewed on them for the same. The tune is, Priscilla.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and W. Gilbertson.,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
